stat_description.ATK: Damage inflicted on each basic attack
stat_description.SPEED: Influences the frequency of attacks, projectiles travel time, movement speed and cooldown times. Maximum 300.
stat_description.CRIT_CHANCE: Critical hits deal 2x more damage. Abilities cannot crit by default. Crit chance over 100% is converted to Crit power.
stat_description.CRIT_POWER: Multiplier for critical hits damage, healing and buffs
stat_description.HP: Pokémon is knocked out when it no longer has Health Points
stat_description.MAX_PP: Amount of PP required to cast ability. Pokémon receive PP over time (10 per second), when attacking (5 per attack) and when receiving damage (10% of incoming damage)
stat_description.AP: Increase SPECIAL and ability effects in various ways.
stat_description.SHIELD: Temporary health points, cannot be healed.
stat_description.LUCK: Multiplier for random draws, influences all effects involving chance.

status_description.BURN: Deals 5% of max HP as TRUE every second. Reduce healing by 50%.
status_description.SILENCE: Prevents casting abilities and gaining PP
status_description.FATIGUE: Reduce PP gain from all sources by 50%
status_description.POISONNED: Deals 5% of max HP per stack as TRUE every second. Can stack up to 3 times by default.
status_description.PROTECT: Protects from any source of damage, but prevents healing and PP gain. Enemies will avoid targeting a protected unit.
status_description.SLEEP: Prevents moving, dodging or attacking. Receiving attacks reduces the duration of the effect.
status_description.CONFUSION: Force to change target all the time and sometimes deal damage to itself
status_description.RAGE: Double all damage, get +80 SPEED. Half healing, SHIELD, FREEZE and SLEEP durations, and lose PROTECT. All units become RAGE after 35 seconds of fight.
status_description.RESURECTION: Prevents KO once, restoring to base max HP. Buffs, stacks and statuses are reset upon resurrection.
status_description.PARALYSIS: Reduce the effectiveness of SPEED by 50% and prevents dodging attacks
status_description.POKERUS: Every 2.5 seconds, gain 1 ATK and 10 AP before infecting 2 ADJACENT allies with POKERUS
status_description.ARMOR_BREAK: Reduce the effectiveness of DEF & SPE_DEF by 50%
status_description.CHARM: Prevents attacking the target and forces to get closer to it
status_description.CURSE: KOs the cursed Pokémon after some time
status_description.POSSESSED: Fight for the other team temporarily. Becomes CHARM if the target is the only enemy remaining
status_description.LOCKED: Prevents moving and sets RANGE to 1
status_description.ELECTRIC_FIELD: Increase damage dealt by ELECTRIC Pokémon by 20%
status_description.PSYCHIC_FIELD: Increase damage dealt by PSYCHIC Pokémon by 20%
status_description.GRASS_FIELD: Increase damage dealt by GRASS Pokémon by 20%
status_description.FAIRY_FIELD: Increase damage dealt by FAIRY Pokémon by 20%

synergy_description.NORMAL: NORMAL Pokémon and their ADJACENT allies gain SHIELD when combat starts.
synergy_description.GRASS: GRASS Pokémon heal and produce berries over time.
synergy_description.FIRE: FIRE Pokémon have a chance to BURN their enemies, and gain ATK after every attack.
synergy_description.WATER: WATER Pokémon generate more PP and can be fished with a rod.
synergy_description.ELECTRIC: ELECTRIC Pokémon basic attacks can trigger two additional attacks.
synergy_description.FIGHTING: FIGHTING Pokémon block a flat amount of damage on every hit received. After 10 hits blocked, throw the target away, destroying their SHIELD.
synergy_description.PSYCHIC: PSYCHIC Pokémon gain additional AP and attract Unowns.
synergy_description.DARK: DARK Pokémon's critical hits are more powerful and more frequent. Melee Dark Pokémon jump to the farthest target reachable.
synergy_description.STEEL: STEEL Pokémon deal a percentage of their damage as TRUE.
synergy_description.GROUND: GROUND Pokémon dig holes on board in between stages, and gain stats based on the depth of the hole they start in. They sometimes find buried items at max depth (5 stages).
synergy_description.POISON: POISON Pokémon have a chance to POISONNED their target for 4 seconds with their basic attacks. Poison inflicts TRUE over time
synergy_description.DRAGON: DRAGON amplify synergies and gain more stats when fully evolved.{{additionalInfo}}
synergy_description.FIELD: When a FIELD Pokémon is KO'd, all the other FIELD Pokémon are healed and gain SPEED
synergy_description.MONSTER: MONSTER Pokémon can FLINCH their opponents for 3 seconds on attack. Every time they get a KO, they gain stats, heal and grow in size.
synergy_description.HUMAN: HUMAN Pokémon heal for a percentage of the damage they deal with attacks and abilities, and can learn a new ability with TMs and HMs.
synergy_description.AQUATIC: AQUATIC Pokémon reduce the duration of status afflictions for all your team. After 8 seconds, a tidal wave cleans up negative status and field effects, heals your AQUATIC allies, and knocks back and damages enemies.
synergy_description.BUG: At the start of combat spawns a copy of your STRONGEST BUG Pokémon.
synergy_description.FLYING: FLYING Pokémon fly away when they fall under a certain amount of HP unless affected by PARALYSIS, FREEZE, LOCKED or SLEEP.
synergy_description.FLORA: When a FLORA Pokémon is KO'd, a Flower Pot blossoms and you collect RICH_MULCH. Higher STAR units give more mulch, which can be used to evolve your Flower Pots.
synergy_description.ROCK: ROCK Pokémon gain DEF, better resist to critical attacks, and can adapt to weather.
synergy_description.GHOST: GHOST applies various curses on opposing Pokémon. GHOST Pokémon have a [15,LK]% chance to dodge attacks and apply SILENCE on hit when synergy active.
synergy_description.FAIRY: FAIRY Pokémon deal additional SPECIAL with their attacks and trigger shocks when critically hit, retaliating for 30% of incoming damage.
synergy_description.ICE: ICE Pokémon have a chance to FREEZE the enemy for 2 seconds after a hit and give SPE_DEF to your whole team.
synergy_description.FOSSIL: FOSSIL Pokémon survive the first hit that would knock them out, taking the damage into SHIELD instead and gaining ATK.
synergy_description.SOUND: SOUND Pokémon emit a cry when they use their abilities, waking up sleeping allies and giving them bonus stats.
synergy_description.ARTIFICIAL: ARTIFICIAL Pokémon give unique items and gain ATK, AP and SHIELD when holding items.
synergy_description.BABY: BABY Pokémon have a chance to bring you Pokémon Eggs to comfort you after a defeat. Chance stacks with losing streaks.{{additionalInfo}}
synergy_description.LIGHT: LIGHT Pokémon reveal a spotlight on the battlefield. The Pokémon standing in the spotlight at the start of combat gains unique bonuses.
synergy_description.WILD: WILD Pokémon get increased SPEED and ATK, and their attacks can WOUND their target. For each WILD Pokémon STAR on board, gain +1% chance to find WILD in your shops + 5% chance during PvE rounds.{{additionalInfo}}
synergy_description.WILD_ADDITIONAL: Current chance to find a WILD Pokémon: {{wildChance}}%
synergy_description.AMORPHOUS: AMORPHOUS Pokémon are extremely flexible and lack their own shape. Your team gains HP and SPEED by activating a wide variety of synergies.
synergy_description.GOURMET: GOURMET Pokémon can be equipped with a CHEF_HAT. Chefs will cook up their Signature Dish between fights and feed ADJACENT allies, giving them various buffs and effects.

faq.official_game_answer: No, this is a fan game; made by fans, for fans. All rights/credits to The Pokémon Company.
faq.how_pokemon_evolve_answer: You need 3 copies of the same Pokémon to get the evolution. The 3 Pokémon will merge to give the evolved Pokémon. Hatch Pokémon that come from eggs evolve automatically with time every 5 stages.
faq.income_answer: You get 5 gold per round whether you draw, win or lose. You get 1 bonus income per 10 gold saved. A maximum of 5 bonus income accrued at 50 saved gold. You get 1 bonus gold if you win. If you win multiple times, you will also gain extra gold; one bonus gold for every victory/defeat, up to 5 bonus gold for 5 streak wins / 5 streak defeat. Wins/Defeats during PvE stages are not taken into account.
faq.collection: What is the purpose of the collection/boosters ?
faq.collection_answer: When opening boosters, you unlock Pokémon emotes in your personal collection. In case you find duplicates, you get shards instead that you can spend to buy other emotes of that Pokémon in the Collection tab. Emotes are customizations that you can use to incarnate a Pokémon as your avatar, change its default portrait or use to communicate with other players ingame. Everyone will see the emotes that you picked for your Pokémon. Moreover, if you have selected a shiny emotion, the Pokémon will appear shiny to everyone else.
faq.avatars: How do I get new avatars ?
faq.avatars_answer: When unlocking a Pokémon emotion, it will be available in your profile avatar list. You will be able to select it as your avatar.
faq.boosters_answer: You gain boosters each time you level up.
faq.level_answer: You gain experience each time you finish a game. The better your final rank, the more experience you will gain.
faq.mythical: How do I get unique / legendary Pokémon ?
faq.mythical_answer: On stages 10 and 20, portals with synergy symbols will appear. Entering a portal will give the opportunity to select one of six powerful Pokémon, with each symbol guaranteeing a synergy of one of the Pokémon. If no portal is entered, all Pokémon options will be entirely random. Symbols are determined by the synergy levels reached by each remaining player, with 4 symbols per player chosen randomly from a pool of one symbol per each of their reached synergy levels.
faq.ditto_answer: Ditto creates a plain copy of the unit you hover and drop it over. Each Pokémon in shop has a 0.5% chance to be a Ditto at every roll. You can't copy unique and hatch Pokémon.
faq.items_answer: You can gain item components by winning PvE rounds or picking one in an item carousel. You can combine two item components to create a powerful tier 2 item. Every Pokémon can hold up to 3 items. The crafting list of all items is available in the wiki, in the items section.
faq.bots_answer: Bots are created by other players. Bots are theme-based, a Mewtwo bot will always have an Mewtwo in its team at a certain time in the game. Bots have a list of predefined teams at each stage.
faq.create_bot: Can i create my own bot ?
faq.create_bot_answer: Sure. You'll need to be at least level 20 to unlock the Bot Builder gadget. You can use it to create and submit your bot, it will be sent in the #bot-creation channel on Discord for a review by the bot reviewers team.
faq.elo: How does the elo system work ?
faq.elo_answer: The elo system in Pokémon Auto Chess works the same as in other elo based games like Chess, Lol, Starcraft etc... To gain elo points, you need to beat other players. The higher your opponent's elo, the more elo you will gain by defeating them, and vice versa. If you don't play for 20 days, your elo will start to decay (-5 elo/day).
faq.missing_points: I didn't get elo points in my last game, why ?
faq.missing_points_answer: Only Ranked game mode enables elo gains and losses.
faq.damage: What are the special damages and physical damages ?
faq.damage_answer: Auto attacks mostly deal Physical damage, while Abilities mostly deal Special damage. Some abilities however can deal true damage or physical damage.
faq.shiny: How do you get shiny Pokémon ?
faq.shiny_answer: By unlocking or buying a shiny Pokémon emotion in your collection. Select that shiny emotion, then you will get that one Pokémon as a shiny ingame.
faq.support: How can i support the game ?
faq.mobile: Will there be a mobile version one day ?
faq.code: What language/library is used to code the game ?
faq.code_answer: TypeScript, Phaser, Colyseus. If you want to contribute

smeargle_scribble_description:
Play for fun ! 8 players, Elo disabled
A new special rule is added for this game.
smeargle_scribble_hint: Smeargle scribbles a new random rule applied during the entire game.
classic_description:
The casual PAC Experience !
8 players, Elo disabled, open to everyone.
classic_hint: The game will automatically start when 8 players joined
custom_room_description: Create a private room to play with your friends or with bots
boosters_hint: Play more games to level up and earn new boosters.
open_boosters_hint: Open boosters to unlock new avatars and complete your collection !
bot_ready_submission: If you think that your bot is ready, you can submit your bot. It will be reviewed by a Bot Manager and added to the server if accepted.
bot_submitted_success: Your bot has been submitted successfully. You can follow the progress and ask questions in the Discord channel #bot-creation.
bot_submission_failed:
An error occurred while submitting your bot: {{error}}.
Please try again later, and if not solved, post a #bug-report on Discord.
help_create_bot: To create a bot, you need to fill a certain number of steps. Each step represents the state of your bot at a moment in the game   The bot will start with the team defined on step 1. Then, it will go   to step 2 and so on   The team of the step 2 should always be stronger than the step 1   team   As the player cannot get more than 10 Pokémon/step, your bot is not   allowed too.
author: Author
points_required_hint: Points required represent how much your bot needs to work to get to the next step
next_step_hint: Once your bot has acquired enough points, it will go to the next step
victory_step_hint: For a victory, your bot will get 1.5 point
defeat_step_hint: For a defeat or a draw, your bot will get 1 point
step_bot_hint: The more points you require, the longer the bot will stay on this step
show_only_available_picks: Show only available add picks / regionals
buy_booster: Buy a new booster for {{cost}} shards
additional_pokemon_hint: Each player picked additional Pokémon to be available in all players shop for this game.
regional_pokemon_hint: After travelling to a new region, you will encounter new regional species of Pokémon.
lose_game_hint: You lose the game when you have no more Health Points
passive_income_hint: Each stage, gain 5 GOLD + 1 extra GOLD if you won the previous battle.
victory_income_hint: Gain 1 bonus GOLD for every victory or defeat streak, up to 5 bonus GOLD.
additional_income_hint: Gain 1 bonus GOLD per 10 GOLD saved, up to {{maxInterest}} bonus income at {{maxInterestGolds}} saved GOLD.
renderer_info: WebGL is faster but may cause visual glitches on some devices. Canvas is slower but more compatible.
show_details_on_hover: Show details on hover instead of right click
pick_additional_pokemon_hint: Pick an additional Pokémon. It will be available to everyone.
pick_first_partner_hint: Pick your starter. You will get a copy of it every stage up to stage 10
free_slot_hint: You must have one free slot on the bench, or two for Duos
increase_level_hint: Increase your level to raise your chances to get higher tier Pokémon.
team_size_hint: Increase your team size by leveling up
user_id_hint2: Use it to communicate with moderators or admins. Contrary to names, each user ID is unique and cannot be changed.
name: Name
delete_account_hint: If you want your account to be permanently removed, click below and type "$t(delete_account_passphrase)"
delete_account_confirmation_failed: The confirmmation passphrase was invalid. The account deletion has not been confirmed.
anonymous_users_name_hint: Anonymous users cannot change their name.
craftable_items_description: Combine two components to create powerful items !
berries_description: When GRASS synergy is active, you can collect berries by clicking on the berry trees next to your avatar.
dishes_description: Dishes are cooked by GOURMET chefs to give strong buffs to a Pokémon in the next fight.
artificial_items_description: ARTIFICIAL synergy gives you exclusive items. Three of them are randomly picked each game for each player. These items are dropped when benching the unit.
weather_rocks_description: Weather rocks are found after fighting under a certain weather with ROCK synergy active, and provide bonuses to your team when this weather is active. Their effects can be cumulated.
gems_description: Gems can be found in the GROUND and increase synergy levels.
tm_hm_description: HUMAN synergy gives you TM/HM when activated. They can be used to change the ability of a HUMAN Pokémon.
special_items_description: These items are exclusive to some Pokémon or synergies, and cannot be obtained by other means.
shiny_items_description: If you are lucky enough to fight a shiny team during PvE rounds or find a golden egg, you will receive a shiny item as a reward.
no_elo_hint: This game is just for fun, no Elo gain/loss !
eligible_elo_hint: ✔ This game is eligible for Elo gain/loss.
not_eligible_elo_hint: ❌Games with bots only are not eligible for Elo gain/loss.
add_bot_or_wait_hint: Add bots or wait for more players to join your room
wait_for_players_hint: Wait for more players to join your room
make_room_private_hint: Add a password to this room
tutorial_work: for their work on tutorial videos !
weather_dominant_hint: The dominant type of Pokémon on the board during a battle can influence the weather, which has various effects on all of your team's and opponent's Pokémon.
weather_dominant_hint2: It requires a certain number of Pokémon of a type on the board to change the weather. Some powerful Pokémon can also change weather by their own.
region_hint1: Some Pokémon can only be found in certain regions, or have regional variations that replace their base form.
region_hint2: You can travel to a different region by taking a portal at stages 0, 10 and 20. The portal symbols will influence the destination.
town_encounters_hint: You can encounter town residents on carousel stages in Treasure Town. They can sell special items or trigger special events.
town_encounters_hint2: Town encounters often come with a trade-off so don't feel forced to take what they have to offer !
invalid_username: Invalid username. Username must be between 3 and 24 characters, start with a letter, only contain letters or numbers or ".-_" , no whitespaces.
username_disclaimer: Inappropriate usernames will lead to a ban of your account. This includes profanity, adult/sexual themes, direct & indirect threats, political statements, and advertisement for things not related to the game.
play_more_games_hint: Play more games to earn boosters and unlock new avatars !
community_translations:
Translations are managed by the community. If you want to add or
              help improve a translation, head over to
loading_complete: Loading complete, waiting for other players...
game-reconnect-modal-body: You left a game in progress. Do you want to reconnect to your previous game ?
game-surrender-modal-body: Game is not finished. Do you want to surrender ?
creator: Creator

gadget.trainer_card_desc: Lets you change your name, avatar, and title
gadget.bag_desc: Used to store your collection and boosters cards
gadget.bot_builder_desc: Create your own bots and submit them to have a chance to be included in the game
gadget.gameboy_desc: Play the Gameboy prototype of the game
gadget.pokeguesser_desc: Guess the Pokémon trivia game when waiting for lobby to start

room_is_private: This room is private. Enter password
min_rank_not_reached: Your rank is not high enough to play this ranked match
max_rank_not_reached: Your rank is too high to play this ranked match
not_whitelisted: This match is restricted to a whitelist of players
blacklisted: You have been kicked from this match

scribble_description.EVERYONE_IS_HERE: All the additional picks are available immediately
scribble_description.UNIQUE_STARTER: Get a random Unique at stage 1
scribble_description.OMELETTE_COOK: Get a Pokémon Egg after stage 1, 2 and 3
scribble_description.DITTO_PARTY: Start with 5 Ditto on your bench. Ditto cannot be found in the shop and cannot be sold.
scribble_description.GOTTA_CATCH_EM_ALL: Some Pokémon can be caught before each PvE round
scribble_description.TECHNOLOGIC: Choose between 3 artifacts at stage 3 and 15
scribble_description.FREE_MARKET: Pokémon are bought and sold for 0 GOLD
scribble_description.SHINY_HUNTER: Wild PvE encounters at stage 1, 9 and 19 are shiny
scribble_description.DO_IT_ALL_YOURSELF: Start with a copy of your avatar. Lower rarity avatars get additional max HP and starting gold.
scribble_description.FIRST_PARTNER: Choose your starter Pokémon. You get a copy of this unit every stage up to stage 10.
scribble_description.SLAMINGO: All items are dropped when a Pokémon is put on the bench. Starts with 4 random components.
scribble_description.BLOOD_MONEY: Every KO gives 1 GOLD (excluding clones and spawns). No extra income from interests.
scribble_description.TOWN_FESTIVAL: You always get an encounter in town and all the carousel items are free.
scribble_description.HIGH_ROLLER: Shops have a chance to contain Hatch at stages 0-10, Unique at stages 10-20 and Legendary after stage 20.
scribble_description.REGIONAL_SPECIALTIES: Your current region types count towards your synergies. After changing region, your team tastes a local dish.

town_encounter_description.KECLEON: Kecleon sells Synergy stones for {{cost}} GOLD
town_encounter_description.ELECTIVIRE: Electivire sells Artificial items for {{cost}} GOLD
town_encounter_description.XATU: Xatu sells a TREASURE_BOX containing 2 random item components for {{cost}} GOLD
town_encounter_description.KANGASKHAN: Kangashkhan sells complete craftable items for {{cost}} GOLD
town_encounter_description.DUSKULL: Duskull proposes coins that increase your long term money income
town_encounter_description.MEOWTH: Meowth proposes AMULET_COIN that let you earn GOLD from kills but reduce your max interest
town_encounter_description.MAROWAK: Marowak makes the next PvE fight more difficult
town_encounter_description.WOBBUFFET: Wobbuffet let you recycle an unused item component or crafted item
town_encounter_description.SPINDA: Spinda changes the direction of rotation of the carousel randomly
town_encounter_description.REGIROCK: Regirock grants all players 15 additional HP
town_encounter_description.MUNCHLAX: Munchlax brought a PICNIC_SET for everyone
town_encounter_description.SABLEYE: Sableye proposes synergy gems that increase your synergies levels
town_encounter_description.CELEBI: Celebi predicts the next PvE fight will be shiny

loading_hints.tab_out: Don't tab out! Loading is paused when this browser window is inactive.
loading_hints.max_loading_time: Game will start after maximum 5 minutes of loading, no matter what...
loading_hints.disconnection_time: Players disconnected for more than 3 minutes are kicked out of the game. If it happens before stage 6, they won't lose Elo.
loading_hints.translation_project: Translations in game are managed by the community ! Check on Discord if you want to contribute.
loading_hints.discord: Join our Discord to meet the community! Link in the side menu
loading_hints.bug_report: You found a bug ? Go on Discord and report it in #bug-report channel.
loading_hints.moderation: If you witness bad behavior on the game, take a screenshot and report it to a moderator on Discord.
loading_hints.berry_tree: Playing Grass ? Don't forget to take care of the berry trees next to your character.
loading_hints.spriters: Many of the game's animations are the work of independent artists. Some take commissions, so you can sponsor them. More info on Discord
loading_hints.wiki: The game has a complete wiki accessible from the side menu, don't miss it!
loading_hints.avatar: To change your player avatar, play games to earn XP and level up. Each level grants you a booster which when opened gives you new avatars that can be chosen in the Collection menu.

wiki.data_description: Various data about the game for the geeks
wiki.tiers_by_level_description: The odds of getting a certain rarity of Pokémon in your shop changes with your player level. The higher the level, the higher the rarity and the cost in the shop.
wiki.experience_by_rank_description: You gain experience points at the end of each game based on your final rank. Every 1000 XP, you level up and gain one booster.
wiki.booster_rarity_probability_description: The chances to find a Pokémon in a booster pack depends on its rarity.
wiki.ditto_rate: Chance to find Ditto in shop
wiki.kecleon_rate: Chance to find Kecleon in stage 10 propositions
wiki.arceus_rate: Chance to find Arceus in stage 20 propositions
wiki.fishing_rarity_rate_description: The quality of the rod you use to fish influences the rarity of the Pokémon you can catch.
wiki.defense_calculation_description: Same system as League of Legends: Damage = ATK / (1+(0.05*DEF)), rounded up. DEF works for PHYSICAL, SPE_DEF for SPECIAL.
wiki.round_damage_calculation_description: The damage inflicted to player after losing a round is computed like this: Round damage = (stage level / 2) + (number of opponents alive) ; rounded up, clones/spawns do not count
wiki.pool_size_per_category_description: The Pokémon you find in shops are taken from a pool shared by all players. The number of specimens of each Pokémon in the pool depends on its rarity and its number of evolution stages.

technical_terms_definitions.STRONGEST: Strongest is defined as, by order of priority: 1. Number of items held, 2. Unit tier, 3. Unit rarity
technical_terms_definitions.ADJACENT_IN_THE_SAME_ROW: the tiles directly to the left and right of a unit
technical_terms_definitions.CONE: shooting at a 90 degrees angle in front of the unit, centered on the target

victory_road.title: Victory Road
victory_road.instructions: Race to the finish of Victory Road !
victory_road.help1: Playing Ranked games grants you points based on your final rank.
victory_road.help2: Be the first to reach 500 points to win the race and get an exclusive title !
victory_road.reset_info: All scores will be reset at midnight UTC on the first day of each month, that is in {{resetCountdown}}. The event leaderboard is refreshed every 10 minutes.
